intro: Maba mildbraedii, commonly known as the African silverleaf tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various wildlife species. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
